abstract.p: Fifty-two percent of professional women surveyed by World Women in Technology, businesswomen's networking group, feel that their gender keeps them from progressing in their careers (S)

block.p: The Good Old Boys Club is alive and well in corporate America, at least in the eyes of many professional women. Fifty-two percent of the 20,000 women surveyed last spring by World Women in Technology, a global online networking group for businesswomen, felt that their gender kept them from progressing in their careers. When asked what would help them reach a higher level, 57 percent cited a mentor or a coach, while 34 percent said training or education. Thirty-three percent said ''a more supportive work environment'' and 21 percent ''a more supportive boss.'' (Respondents could choose more than one answer.)
